meanings.definition: To make or become rich or richer.
meanings.sent1: She hoped her new job would richen her life.
meanings.sent2: The rain helped to richen the soil in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to richen the soup by adding more spices, but it ended up too salty.
meanings.sent4: His kindness seemed to richen the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The golden sunset seemed to richen the colors of the sky.

meanings.definition: To add richness or depth to something.
meanings.sent1: The artist used vibrant colors to richen the painting.
meanings.sent2: A touch of cinnamon can richen the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The storyteller decided to richen the plot by introducing a mysterious character.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to richen the joy of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The music score was carefully composed to richen the emotional impact of the scene.
